Comment: My wife ordered two things from one of those sites. I can't remember if it was Temu or Wish or Alibaba but whatever it was, it was absolute garbage; just useless junk, so shoddily made that she couldn't even use it. It took up space until she eventually threw it away.  Whenever I walk through Walmart nowadays, I look around in disgust at how much useless, cheaply made garbage is flooding into this country. These tariffs are a step in the right direction. We need quality over quantity.

Comment: I spent a winter processing clothing returns in an Amazon warehouse. The synthetic smell from all of that clothing was *bad.* It was rare to find anything made of cotton, or even a cotton blend. The quality was abysmal -- crooked seams, etc.   Look back at photos from the 1950s-60s and the way people dressed. We have lost so much.
